Ricardo J. Mï¿½ndez wrote:

>Many thanks for the pointer, Colin, I'll read the paper.  I noticed
>you mentioned modular NEAT on the naming thread - do you have plans in
>the near future for implementing this sort of thing in sharpNeat?
>  
>
Yes although 'near future' may be an ambitious term here. As discussed 
on the other thread I want to provide a mechanism for plugging in 
different kinds of genomes in as abstract a way as possible. This should 
then facilitate experimentation with different types of genome 
encodings. I don't have one specific encoding in mind though, just a 
bunch of ideas, but re-use of sub-structures is one of the main 
characteristics I'm interested in.

Colin.
